section.title: Distribution Upgrade with zypper
section.para: With the zypper command line utility you can upgrade to the next version of the distribution. Most importantly, you can initiate the system upgrade process from within the running system.
This feature is attractive for advanced users who want to run remote upgrades or upgrades on many similarly configured systems.

section.title: Before Starting the Upgrade with zypper
section.para: To avoid unexpected errors during the upgrade process using zypper, minimize risky constellations.

Upgrade from the previous version (e.g., 12.3) to current version (13.1)—do not skip any minor version inbetween (this means, do not upgrade from 11.2 or earlier to 13.1 in one go). Make sure all available 12.3 online updates are successfully applied.

listitem.para: Close as many applications and unneeded services as possible and log out all regular users.

Disable third party or &obs; repositories before starting the upgrade, or lower the priority of these repositories to make sure packages from the default system repositories will get preference. Enable them again after the upgrade and edit their version string to match the version number of the distribution of the upgraded now running system.

warning.title: Perform Upgrades from Reboot
warning.para: The upgrade process has to be done completely from beginning to reboot. There is only a limited chance to revert changes. Furthermore, the server has to be connected online during the whole process.
